S1.T1.caption: TABLE I: An overview of selected surveys about FL in wireless communications.
S1.T1.table:
Subject Contributions Related Work
FL Introductory tutorial on unique characteristics and challenges of FL [20]
FL Challenges of FL implementation [21]
Edge machine learning Challenges of machine learning systems at the edge computer networks [22]
FL FL and RL for optimizing mobile edge computing and caching [23]
Edge machine learning Edge machine learning architectures [24]
FL FL application and use-cases [25]
references: There are some interesting surveys about FL in wireless communications such as

.
The unique characteristics and challenges of FL were discussed in

.
Moreover, this work provided an overview of the current approaches, and outlined several directions of future work.
The work in

introduced the challenges of FL implementation and reviewed the
existing solutions.
In

, the authors
described the challenges of machine learning systems that are configured at the edge computer networks.
Considering RL,
the authors in

proposed to integrate deep RL techniques and the FL framework with mobile edge systems, for optimizing mobile edge computing, caching and wireless communication resource.
In addition, the work in

explored the key building blocks of edge machine learning and different wireless network architectural splits for wireless communications.
The study about FL application was surveyed in
including software and hardware platforms, protocols, real-life applications and use-cases.

We aim to gather the state-of-the-art contributions that address the key challenges of applying
FL techniques for wireless networks. In particular,
our objectives are three-fold: to provide a comprehensive descriptions of FL algorithm,
to identify the key open problems in wireless communication that can
be addressed using FL methods, and to point out the emerging applications in wireless communication with FL.
